Key Match Events: Ben Lively tossed five efficient innings, holding the Rays scoreless on just 59 pitches.
Emmanuel Clase picked up his league-leading 45th save, a career high.
Angel Martinez scored from third on a bloop hit off José Ramírez, giving the Guardians a 2-0 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Guardians tried to give Cuyahoga Council free tickets. Ohio Ethics Commission said no.
The Guardians manager Stephen Vogt praised Brayan Rocchio for his ability to come up with big hits.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt said Rocchio is a smart baseball player, and he is developing into the type of hitter he will someday be.
Ramírez finished with a pair of hits, including a double in the first inning that extended his on-base streak to 14 games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brayan Rocchio bunted successfully, scoring Daniel Schneemann with an RBI single.
Lively told reporters after the game that he wanted to carry the success he was having through two innings in Chicago into his outing against the Rays.
The Guardians added a run in the fifth when Angel Martinez scored from third on a bloop hit off José Ramírez.
